chromestatus.comments: Chromium turned MathML in M24, but soon disabled it. There are no plans to support it moving forward. See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=152430#c43
chromestatus.name: MathML
chromestatus.summary: An application of XML for describing mathematical notations and capturing both its structure and content.
chromestatus.visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news

chromestatus.comments:
Never exposed to developers.

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/d/msg/blink-dev/b54nW_mGSVU/paAZR1K0JRYJ
chromestatus.name: Microdata
chromestatus.summary: Microdata is used to nest semantics within existing content on web pages.
chromestatus.visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

chromestatus.name: Navigation Transitions
chromestatus.summary: Allows web authors to both improve the perceived loading speed as well as provide visual polish by allowing two pages to coordinate on a transition animation (regardless of their origin).
chromestatus.visibility: Likely in mainstream tech news

chromestatus.name: SrcN
chromestatus.summary: SrcN is a responsive images solution which addresses all 3 major use-cases within a single syntax. It addresses DPR switching (like srcset), art-direction (like picture) and viewport dimensions based switching.
chromestatus.visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

chromestatus.comments: This could have compatibility issues as we are changing the data type for existing properties. Some websites may depend on the values being integers.
doc_links: Latest version of spec has these back to Integer given feedback from browser vendors and web developers.
chromestatus.name: Subpixel precision for clientWidth, offsetWidth, scrollTop, et al
chromestatus.summary:
The latest draft of the CSS OM spec changed the type for a number of Element and HTMLElement properties from long to float. 

Specifically the following properties:
Element::clientHeight
Element::clientWidth
Element::clientLeft
Element::clientTop
Element::scrollTop
Element::scrollLeft
Element::scrollWidth
Element::scrollHeight
HTMLElement::offsetWidth
HTMLElement::offsetHeight
HTMLElement::offsetTop
HTMLElement::offsetLeft
chromestatus.visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

chromestatus.comments: Part of https://www.chromestatus.com/features/4540065577435136
chromestatus.name: beforechromeinstallprompt event for install banner [dupe]
chromestatus.summary:
Blink implementation of an event when an app install banner is shown.

Duplicate of: https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/6560913322672128
chromestatus.visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

chromestatus.comments:
Webkit bug with a feature request from web developers, but no (definite) answer from Webkit developers: https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=91463

Removed from the specification: https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/1103
chromestatus.name: beforescriptexecute and afterscriptexecute events
chromestatus.summary: The beforescriptexecute and afterscriptexecute events allows web pages and extension developers to monitor the insertion of <script> tags in a web page and prevent the script from executing.
chromestatus.visibility: Only a very small number of web developers will care about

chromestatus.comments: Intent: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/forum/#!searchin/blink-dev/canvasResolution/blink-dev/fRWlQ3GvlVA/rDomP793wxkJ
chromestatus.name: canvasResolution
chromestatus.summary: Provide css to device pixel ratio through window.screen.canvasResolution
chromestatus.visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

chromestatus.name: navigator.connect
chromestatus.summary:
Allow cross-domain postMessage to a Service Worker.

We are now focusing on the "foreign fetch" solution to this problem proposed by Mozilla rather than this navigator.connect solution.
chromestatus.visibility: Will this feature generate articles on sites like html5rocks.com

chromestatus.comments: Has negative implications for scrolling performance, and so will not be suitable for use on most websites.  Designed for "silk" native-like mobile web applications.
chromestatus.name: scroll-delay
chromestatus.summary: Give advanced web applications the ability to force scrolling to run synchronously with JavaScript in order to enable scroll-linked effects.
chromestatus.visibility: Covered as part of a larger article but not on its own

edgestatus.name: requestIdleCallback
edgestatus.summary: Allows developers to cooperatively schedule background tasks to avoid introducing delays with high priority tasks in the same event loop.

edgestatus.name: Support CSS transforms on SVG
edgestatus.summary: Enable support for CSS transforms on elements and presentational attributes of SVG

edgestatus.name: CSS outline-offset
edgestatus.summary: Allows you to define an offset from the border box for your outline

edgestatus.name: Frame Timing
edgestatus.summary: An interface for web applications to access runtime performance information of the browser event loop.

edgestatus.name: Performance Observer
edgestatus.summary: An interface to observe the performance timeline (https://w3c.github.io/performance-timeline) and receive notifications of new performance entries as they are recorded.

edgestatus.name: CSS Containment
edgestatus.summary: A primitive for isolating style, layout, and paint. This will allow web developers to opt into the various aspects of the pipeline, allowing for UA optimizations.

edgestatus.name: Initial Letter
edgestatus.summary: Allows the author to set the size and depth at which it sinks into the surrounding text.

edgestatus.name: Intersection Observer
edgestatus.summary: An interface to allow a web developer to asynchronously query the position of an element with respect to other elements or the global viewport.

edgestatus.name: Resize Observer
edgestatus.summary: Allows a web developer to attach an observer to an element and a callback will be fired when that element is resized

edgestatus.name: Server Timing
edgestatus.summary: Enables the server to communicate request-response cycle metrics to the user agent, and provides a JavaScript interface to enable applications to access and act on those metrics.

edgestatus.name: Preload
edgestatus.summary: A keyword that may be used with "link" elements which provides a declarative fetch primitive that initiates an early fetch and separates fetching from resoruce execution.

edgestatus.name: DNS Prefetch Resource Hints
edgestatus.summary: A link relation type used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources and that the browser should resolve as early as possible.

edgestatus.name: Preconnect Resource Hints
edgestatus.summary: A link relation type used to indicate an origin that will be used to fetch required resources, so the browser can open a connection early for resouces that will be required later in the loading process.

edgestatus.name: High Resolution Time 2
edgestatus.summary: An API that provies the current time in sub-millisecond resolution and is not subject to system clock skew or adjustments.

edgestatus.name: Brotli Compressed Data Format
edgestatus.summary: Support for the Brotli data format as an HTTP content-encoding method.

edgestatus.name: <datalist> Element
edgestatus.summary: Shows a list of pre-defined options to suggest to the user when entering an input element.

edgestatus.name: Web Authentication API
edgestatus.summary: Web Authentication provides an open, scalable, and interoperable solution to facilitate authentication, which replaces passwords with stronger two-factor credentials.  The implementation in Microsoft Edge is focused on enabling Microsoft Passport with a PIN or Windows Hello to securely authenticate to Microsoft properties and third-party web sites.  As of EdgeHTML 14, the implementation is prefixed and based on the FIDO 2.0 Web APIs. Microsoft is a member of the FIDO Alliance.

edgestatus.name: FIDO U2F
edgestatus.summary: FIDO Universal Second Factor API allows online services to augment the security of their existing password infrastructure by adding a strong second factor to user login via a USB or NFC device. Also see FIDO 2.0 Web APIs, a newer specification that supports additional authentication methods, such as biometrics, and can replace passwords altogether as well as provide U2F functionality.

edgestatus.name: <details>/<summary>
edgestatus.summary: Interactive widget to show/hide content.

edgestatus.name: webkitdirectory and webkitRelativePath
edgestatus.summary: Support for the webkitdirectory attribute on the input tag to make it allow a directory be selected instead of files. Support for the webkitRelativePath property on the File interface to allow the identification of relative paths of files.

edgestatus.name: Directory Upload
edgestatus.summary: Enable directory uploading by allowing a developer to read directory contents (files and sub-directories) asynchronously and be able to identify the directory structure.
Enable a responsive images solution by providing the browser multiple resources in varying resolutions for a single image.

edgestatus.name: Extended srcset and sizes support
edgestatus.summary: Extends the current implementation of the srcset attribute by adding support for the width descriptor and the sizes attribute.

edgestatus.name: <picture> Element
edgestatus.summary: Enable a responsive images solution by declaring multiple resources for an image using CSS media queries.

edgestatus.name: <template> Element
edgestatus.summary: HTML template element to allow creating fragment of inert HTML as a prototype for stamping out DOM (often used in Web Components).

edgestatus.name: <meter> Element
edgestatus.summary: The HTML meter element allows representation of a scalar measurement of a known range, or fractional value, i.e. a gauge. Distinct from the progress element.

edgestatus.name: selectionDirection attribute on text input elements
edgestatus.summary: Returns the string corresponding to the current selection direction on text input elements: "forward", "backward", or "none".

edgestatus.name: oninvalid event handler
edgestatus.summary: Provides specified alert text if an input element is invalid.

edgestatus.name: Canvas 2D ellipse
edgestatus.summary: Provides a method to draw arcs on a 2D canvas drawing surface.

edgestatus.name: Canvas 2D path2D
edgestatus.summary: Path2D objects can be used to declare paths that are then later used on CanvasRenderingContext2D objects.

edgestatus.name: CSS Range Pseudo-classes
edgestatus.summary: :in-range and :out-of-range pseudo-classes to match elements that are candidates for constraint validation, have range limitations, and are/are not suffering from underflow or overflow.

edgestatus.name: CSS Mutability Pseudo-classes
edgestatus.summary: :read-only and :read-write pseudo-classes to match elements which are considered user-alterable for the purposes of Selectors.

edgestatus.name: a[download] attribute
edgestatus.summary: When used on an <a>, this attribute signifies that the resource it points to should be downloaded by the browser rather than navigating to it.

edgestatus.name: Application Cache
edgestatus.summary: Enables web pages to work without the user being connected to the internet

edgestatus.name: Audio tracks
edgestatus.summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple audio tracks, and switch between them using the AudioTrack.enabled attributes.

edgestatus.name: Video tracks
edgestatus.summary: Adds the ability to get information about multiple video tracks, and switch between them using the VideoTrack.selected attributes.

edgestatus.name: Blob
edgestatus.summary: Allows you to construct Blobs directly (var blob = new Blob(["1234"], {type: 'text/plain'})). Blob() constructor also can take ArrayBufferView directly rather than constructing a blob with ArrayBuffer.

edgestatus.name: ES6 Block bindings (let, const, function)
edgestatus.summary: Allows developers to explicitly qualify access to variables within a block.

edgestatus.name: Canvas
edgestatus.summary: Provides an API to draw 2D graphics

edgestatus.name: Canvas focus ring
edgestatus.summary: Adds APIs to the canvas 2D context that make it possible to draw a focus ring around a canvas path and notify the operating system of the bounding box of the focused object for accessibility.

edgestatus.name: Compositing and Blending in Canvas 2D
edgestatus.summary: The canvas 2d context has the globalCompositeOperation attribute that is used to set the current compositing and blending operator.

edgestatus.name: Content Security Policy
edgestatus.summary: Allows you to create an allow list of sources of trusted content, and instructs the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

edgestatus.name: Content Security Policy Level 2
edgestatus.summary: An evolution of the Content Security Policy specification, allowing developers to create a whitelist of sources of trusted content, and instructing the browser to only execute or render resources from those sources.

edgestatus.name: CSS calc()
edgestatus.summary: Method of allowing calculated values for length units, i.e. width: calc(100% - 3em)

edgestatus.name: CSS Device Adaptation
edgestatus.summary: The @viewport rule, in combination with media queries, enabled web developers to optimize the layout of sites and apps for different devices with minimal effort. It generalizes the viewport meta tag to CSS, while being much simpler to understand and without the quirks that exists with the meta tag.

edgestatus.name: CSS touch-action
edgestatus.summary: New CSS property to enable websites to declaratively state how touches should be handled for purposes of scrolling and zooming.

edgestatus.name: CSS Variables
edgestatus.summary: Introduces cascading variables as a new primitive value type that is accepted by all CSS properties, and custom properties for defining them.

edgestatus.name: CSS Will Change
edgestatus.summary: Adds a will-change CSS property, that can be used to signal that a particular property is likely to be changed in the future, or that an element's content is likely to change.

edgestatus.name: CSSOM View smooth scroll API
edgestatus.summary: Adds an optional argument to existing scroll APIs that specifies whether scrolling should be smooth. Also adds a CSS property for this.

edgestatus.name: Custom Elements
edgestatus.summary: Method for registering (creating) custom elements in script (often used in Web Components).

edgestatus.name: Device Motion
edgestatus.summary: Provides access to device's physical motion.

edgestatus.name: Device Orientation
edgestatus.summary: Provides access to device's physical orientation

edgestatus.name: devicePixelRatio on zoom
edgestatus.summary: Update window.devicePixelRatio on full page zoom so that it accurately portrays the ratio between css and device pixels.

edgestatus.name: DOM3 Keyboard Events
edgestatus.summary: KeyboardEvent: keydown, keyup, keypress

edgestatus.name: DOM3 mouseenter & mouseleave Events
edgestatus.summary: DOM event analog of CSS :hover psuedo-selector that fires as the mouse enters and exits the bounding box of an element (including its children).

edgestatus.name: DOM3 Wheel Events
edgestatus.summary: Implementation of the standard DOM Level 3 WheelEvent for mouse wheel rotation.

edgestatus.name: Drag and Drop Directories
edgestatus.summary: Allows dragging and dropping entire folders using HTML5 Drag and Drop. Extends the DataTransferItem with a method to get a FileEntry/DirectoryEntry.

edgestatus.name: Encrypted Media Extensions
edgestatus.summary: Defines a common API that may be used to discover, select and interact with such systems as well as with simpler content encryption systems.

edgestatus.name: Exclusions
edgestatus.summary: Define areas inline content should avoid, and how inline content should wrap around them.

edgestatus.name: Filters
edgestatus.summary: Apply filter effects to arbitrary DOM elements.

edgestatus.name: Flexbox
edgestatus.summary: A CSS box model optimized for user interface design. The children of a flex container can be laid out in any direction and can "flex" their sizes to fill unused space and  avoid overflowing the parent.

edgestatus.name: Fullscreen API
edgestatus.summary: Programmatically instruct content on the page to be presented in the browser's full screen (kiosk) mode.

edgestatus.name: GamePad API
edgestatus.summary: Gives JS access to a game controller via USB.

edgestatus.name: Generated Content for Paged Media
edgestatus.summary: CSS properties helpful for printed publication.

edgestatus.name: Geolocation
edgestatus.summary: Provides access to device's physical location

edgestatus.name: Media Capture and Streams
edgestatus.summary: Provides access to the user's local audio and video input/output devices (getUserMedia API).

edgestatus.name: Gradients
edgestatus.summary: Gradients provide a method to, over a customizable amount of space, transition from one color to another.

edgestatus.name: Grid
edgestatus.summary: A two-dimensional grid-based layout system, optimized for user interface design.

edgestatus.name: HTML Form HTTP Extensions
edgestatus.summary: An addendum to HTML5 forms extending the abilities of configuring HTTP requests through HTML markup.

edgestatus.name: HTML Imports
edgestatus.summary: Import HTML documents into other HTML documents (often used in Web Components).

edgestatus.name: HTTP Client Hints
edgestatus.summary: Header for proactive content negotiation; just as the Accept header allowed clients to indicate what formats they prefer, Client Hints allow clients to indicate a list of device and agent specific preferences.

edgestatus.name: HTTP Strict Transport Security (HSTS)
edgestatus.summary: Header to inform the browser to always request a given domain over SSL, reducing MITM attack surface area.

edgestatus.name: SPDY/3
edgestatus.summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content.

edgestatus.name: HTTP/2
edgestatus.summary: A faster protocol for transporting web content standardized by the IETF.

edgestatus.name: iframe[sandbox] attribute
edgestatus.summary: Method of running external site pages with reduced privileges (i.e. no JavaScript) in iframes (<iframe sandbox="allow-same-origin allow-forms" src="..."></iframe>)

edgestatus.name: iframe[seamless] attribute
edgestatus.summary: The seamless attribute is used to embed an <iframe> in the calling page without scrollbars or borders (e.g. seamlessly) and with the parent document's styles applying to the embedded seamless iframe.

edgestatus.name: iframe[srcdoc] attribute
edgestatus.summary: Gives the content of an iframe as a src context to embed (e.g. ).

edgestatus.name: IME API
edgestatus.summary: Provides Web applications with scripted access to an IME (input-method editor).

edgestatus.name: IndexedDB
edgestatus.summary: An asynchronous client-side storage API offering fast access to large amounts of structured data

edgestatus.name: IndexedDB Arrays and MultiEntry Support
edgestatus.summary: Extends the existing IndexedDB implementation with support for compound keys, indexed array values, and multiEntry.

edgestatus.name: WebGL Instancing Extension
edgestatus.summary: A way to use the GPU to quickly draw a lot of copies of a single object. In some scenes (like a forest with a lot of trees) it is a great way to get a huge performance improvement. Requires a compatible GPU.

edgestatus.name: Map (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Map objects are simple key/value maps.

edgestatus.name: Masks
edgestatus.summary: Allows hiding of portions of a visible elements.

edgestatus.name: matchMedia
edgestatus.summary: API for testing if a given media query will apply.

edgestatus.name: MathML
edgestatus.summary: An application of XML for describing mathematical notations and capturing both its structure and content.

edgestatus.name: Media Queries: resolution feature
edgestatus.summary: Allows to query the device pixel count per CSS unit

edgestatus.name: Media Source Extensions
edgestatus.summary: Allows appending data to an <audio>/<video> element.

edgestatus.name: MediaRecorder
edgestatus.summary: Encode audio and video streams in the browser.

edgestatus.name: Microdata
edgestatus.summary: Microdata is used to nest semantics within existing content on web pages.

edgestatus.name: CSS Transforms - preserve-3d
edgestatus.summary: Augments existing CSS 3d transforms by facilitating the construction of complex 3d scenes.

edgestatus.name: mix-blend-mode
edgestatus.summary: Provides a way to blend an HTML or SVG element with its backdrop

edgestatus.name: background-blend-mode
edgestatus.summary: Specifies the blending mode used for each background layer

edgestatus.name: Cross-Domain Font Loading
edgestatus.summary: Increases interoperability with the web by relaxing domain and licensing metadata restrictions for EOT, WOFF, and TrueType fonts. Development work for IE is currently for Windows Phone only.

edgestatus.name: Multi-column (full support)
edgestatus.summary: Allows content to be flowed into multiple columns with a gap and a rule between them using CSS.

edgestatus.name: Mutation Observers
edgestatus.summary: Provides notifications when DOM nodes are rearranged or modified.

edgestatus.name: Navigation Timing API
edgestatus.summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to navigation and elements.

edgestatus.name: Page Visibility API
edgestatus.summary: Provides an API to ask whether the current tab is visible or not. If so, you might want to throttle back action or set an idle state.

edgestatus.name: Pointer Events
edgestatus.summary: Unified pointer input API (e.g. mouse, pen, touch input) which addresses several existing problems (especially on touchscreen laptops) and provides future extensibility.

edgestatus.name: Pointer Lock (Mouse Lock)
edgestatus.summary: Gives access to raw mouse movement, locks the target of mouse events to a single element, eliminates limits of how far mouse movement can go in a single direction, and removes the cursor from view. Obvious use cases are for first person or real time strategy games.

edgestatus.name: position: sticky
edgestatus.summary: position: sticky is a new way to position elements and is conceptually similar to position: fixed. The difference is that a stickily positioned element behaves like position: relative within its parent, until a given offset threshold is met.

edgestatus.name: postMessage
edgestatus.summary: Safely enables cross-origin communication.

edgestatus.name: Quota Management API
edgestatus.summary: This API can be used to check how much quota an app/origin is using.

edgestatus.name: Regions
edgestatus.summary: Magazine-like content flow into specified regions.

edgestatus.name: requestAnimationFrame()
edgestatus.summary: Offload animation repainting to browser for optimized performance. You should call this method whenever you're ready to update your animation onscreen. This will request that your animation function be called before the browser performs the next repaint.

edgestatus.name: Resource Timing API
edgestatus.summary: Allows web applications to access timing information related to HTML elements.

edgestatus.name: Service Worker
edgestatus.summary: ServiceWorkers (formerly Navigation Controllers) are a new system that provides event-driven scripts that run independent of web pages. They are similar to SharedWorkers except that their lifetime is different and they have access to domain-wide events such as network fetches.

edgestatus.name: Set (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Set objects let you store unique values of any type, whether primitive values or object references.

edgestatus.name: Streams API
edgestatus.summary: An API for representing binary data in web applications as a Stream object.

edgestatus.name: Subpixel font scaling
edgestatus.summary: Allow sub-css-pixel font-sizes and thus smooth font scaling.

edgestatus.name: SVG2
edgestatus.summary: Implement the new SVG2 features.

edgestatus.name: TLS 1.2
edgestatus.summary: The latest version of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol. Allows for data/message confidentiality, and message authentication codes for message integrity and as a by-product message authentication.

edgestatus.name: Track element
edgestatus.summary: Add subtitles, captions, screen reader descriptions, chapters and other types of timed metadata to video and audio.

edgestatus.name: Transforms
edgestatus.summary: Enables changing the position of content in 3D space without disrupting the normal flow. See also preserve-3d.

edgestatus.name: Typed Arrays (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Buffers for holding binary data and working with WebGL & Audio API: ArrayBuffer, Float32Array , Int16Array, Uint8Array, etc.)

edgestatus.name: UIEvents - Keyboard Query APIs
edgestatus.summary: Identify the physical key being pressed; Query key from layout.

edgestatus.name: URL API
edgestatus.summary: Expose constructible URL objects that can be manipulated and combined.

edgestatus.name: User Timing API
edgestatus.summary: Helps web developers measure the performance of their applications by giving them access to high precision timestamps.

edgestatus.name: Vibration API
edgestatus.summary: This specification defines an API that provides access to the vibration mechanism of the hosting device. Vibration is a form of tactile feedback.

edgestatus.name: WeakMap (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: WeakMaps are key/value maps in which keys are objects.

edgestatus.name: Web Animations JavaScript API
edgestatus.summary: A unified model for supporting animation and synchronization on the Web platform.

edgestatus.name: Web Crypto API
edgestatus.summary: JavaScript bindings for cryptographic operations. Note: we are looking to update our current implementation to the latest W3C Last Call Working Draft specification.

edgestatus.name: Web MIDI API
edgestatus.summary: Defines an API supporting the MIDI protocol, enabling web applications to enumerate and select MIDI input and output devices on the client system and send and receive MIDI messages.

edgestatus.name: Web Notifications
edgestatus.summary: An API for displaying simple notifications to the user.

edgestatus.name: Web Speech API (input)
edgestatus.summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech recognition into their web pages.

edgestatus.name: Web Speech API (synthesis)
edgestatus.summary: Enables web developers to incorporate speech synthesis into their web pages.

edgestatus.name: Web SQL Database
edgestatus.summary: API exposing an SQLite database

edgestatus.name: Web Storage
edgestatus.summary: Refers to both localStorage and sessionStorage

edgestatus.name: WebGL  (Canvas 3D)
edgestatus.summary: 3D rendering via the <canvas> element.

edgestatus.name: WebGL 2.0
edgestatus.summary: An update to WebGL, based on OpenGL ES 3.0

edgestatus.name: WebP image format support
edgestatus.summary: WebP is an image format that provides lossless and lossy compression for images on the web.

edgestatus.name: WebRTC – WebRTC v1.0 API
edgestatus.summary: Real-time communication in the browser. See also "Web RTC - Object RTC API".

edgestatus.name: WebRTC – Object RTC API
edgestatus.summary: Enables mobile endpoints to talk to servers and web browsers with Real-Time Communications (ORTC) capabilities via native and simple JavaScript APIs.

edgestatus.name: WebSocket
edgestatus.summary: The WebSockets JavaScript API provides a simple API for bi-directional communication with web servers. The WebSocket network protocol enables low overhead bi-directional communication with web servers over a persistent TCP connection.

edgestatus.name: XMLHttpRequest timeout
edgestatus.summary: Exposing the XHR timeout property and sending corresponding events such as ontimeout.

edgestatus.name: Arrow function (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: The arrow (=>) provides a shorthand for the function keyword with lexical 'this' binding.

edgestatus.name: Box Alignment
edgestatus.summary: CSS properties for aligning boxes within their container. Allows for true vertical centering among other features.

edgestatus.name: CSS filter() image function
edgestatus.summary: The function allows filtering an CSS input image with a set of filter functions. The used filter functions are the same as for the CSS filter property. The filter() function can be animated as well.

edgestatus.name: Default parameter (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Allows formal parameters to be initialized with default values if no value is passed.

edgestatus.name: Destructuring (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Destructuring assignment allows extracting data from arrays or objects using a syntax that mirrors array and object literals.

edgestatus.name: Rest parameters (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Allows representation of an indefinite number of arguments as an array.

edgestatus.name: Ambient Light Events
edgestatus.summary: Ambient Light Event API which is a handy way to make a web page or web app aware of any change in light intensity.

edgestatus.name: Battery Status API
edgestatus.summary: Allows access to see the battery level of the device's battery

edgestatus.name: Push API
edgestatus.summary: Provides webapps with scripted access to server-sent notifications.

edgestatus.name: Subresource Integrity
edgestatus.summary: Subresource Integrity defines a mechanism by which user agents may verify that a fetched resource has been delivered without unexpected manipulation. In a nutshell, metadata inlined into HTML elements allows the browser to determine whether the resource that was downloaded matches the resource the page's author expected to download.

edgestatus.name: CSS Intrinsic Sizing
edgestatus.summary: Extends the CSS sizing properties with keywords that represent content-based "intrinsic" sizes and context-based "extrinsic" sizes, allowing CSS to more easily describe boxes that fit their content or fit into a particular layout context.

edgestatus.name: CSS font-stretch
edgestatus.summary: Add support for the CSS font-stretch property.

edgestatus.name: Canvas2D text decoration
edgestatus.summary: Add a textDecoration attribute to canvas 2D contexts, behavior similar to existing "font" attribute: It's a DOMString, parsed the same way as corresponding CSS property (text-decoration).

edgestatus.name: ES6 Iterators (i.e. the for-of feature)
edgestatus.summary: Iterates over iterable objects (including arrays, array-like objects, iterators and generators), invoking a custom iteration hook with statements to be executed for the value of each distinct property.

edgestatus.name: Network Error Logging
edgestatus.summary: This specification defines an interface to store and retrieve error data related to the previous navigations of a document.

edgestatus.name: Shapes
edgestatus.summary: Define arbitrary shapes inside and around which inline content can flow.

edgestatus.name: Symbols (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Allows properties to be added to existing objects without the possibility of interference with the existing properties, unintended visibility, or with other uncoordinated additions by any other code.

edgestatus.name: WebGL Shared Resources
edgestatus.summary: Allow sharing resources between 2 or more WebGL contexts

edgestatus.name: inputmode
edgestatus.summary: The inputmode content attribute is an enumerated attribute that specifies what kind of input mechanism would be most helpful for users entering content into the form control.

edgestatus.name: Object.observe()
edgestatus.summary: Observe changes to JS objects.

edgestatus.name: Shadow DOM
edgestatus.summary: Enables DOM tree encapsulation. Without it, widgets may inadvertently break pages by using conflicting CSS selectors, class or id names, or JavaScript variables (often used in Web Components).

edgestatus.name: Web Audio API
edgestatus.summary: A high-level JavaScript API for processing and synthesizing audio in web applications

edgestatus.name: object-fit and object-position
edgestatus.summary: CSS properties that control the position and size of replaced content within the content box

edgestatus.name: Conditional Rules
edgestatus.summary: Support for the @supports at-rule and the "window.CSS.supports()" API

edgestatus.name: Generators (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: A generator is a special type of function that works as a factory for iterators.

edgestatus.name: Custom filters (shaders)
edgestatus.summary: Filter effects are a way of processing an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document.

edgestatus.name: High Resolution Time
edgestatus.summary: Enables reliable, high-resolution timing of client-side performance.

edgestatus.name: Scoped Styles
edgestatus.summary: Boolean attribute for the <style> element (<style scoped>). When present, its styles only apply to the parent element.

edgestatus.name: Proxies (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Proxies are objects for which the programmer has to define the semantics in JavaScript.

edgestatus.name: Touch Events
edgestatus.summary: Touchscreen input API, originally introduced by Apple on iOS. Support is currently limited to only devices with a touchscreen (can be overridden in about:flags). See Pointer Events for touch, pen, and mouse input across all device types.

edgestatus.name: Runtime error reporting: ErrorEvent.
edgestatus.summary: Unhandled exceptions trigger the 'window.onerror' callback (or 'self.onerror' inside Workers) for centralized handling.

edgestatus.name: FileWriter
edgestatus.summary: Enables writing to files from web applications.

edgestatus.name: FileReader
edgestatus.summary: The FileReader object lets web applications asynchronously read the contents of files (or raw data buffers) stored on the user's computer, using File or Blob objects to specify the file or data to read.

edgestatus.name: Server-Sent Events (EventSource)
edgestatus.summary: Enables push notifications from the server received as DOM events.

edgestatus.name: Message Channels
edgestatus.summary: A messaging system that allows documents to communicate with each other regardless of their source domain, in a way designed to avoid cross-site scripting attacks.

edgestatus.name: Efficient Script Yielding - setImmediate()
edgestatus.summary: Allows web applications to flush the browser event queue and receive an immediate callback.

edgestatus.name: Beacon
edgestatus.summary: Enables web applications to asynchronously transfer data from the user agent to a web server, with the user agent taking the responsibility to eventually send the data.

edgestatus.name: Prefetch Resource Hints
edgestatus.summary: Indicates the browser should preemptively fetch and cache the specified resource.

edgestatus.name: Prerender Resource Hints
edgestatus.summary: Provides a hint to the browser that another page is likely to be loaded by the user (such as the first result of a search) such that it may be prerendered for better performance.

edgestatus.name: CSS Scrolling Snap Points
edgestatus.summary: Enables rich, customizable, and performant scrolling experiences like pagination of carousels by using snap points that enforce the scroll offsets that a scroll container may end at after a scrolling operation has completed.

edgestatus.name: DOM Level 3 XPath
edgestatus.summary: Provides simple functionality to access a DOM tree using the XPath syntax.

edgestatus.name: Screen Orientation API
edgestatus.summary: Provides the ability to read the screen orientation state, to be informed when this state changes, and to be able to lock the screen orientation to a specific state.

edgestatus.name: CSS pointer-events
edgestatus.summary: Enables control of whether an element can receive input events from a pointing device using an API similar to the existing pointer-events property from SVG.

edgestatus.name: WebDriver
edgestatus.summary: A platform and language-neutral interface and associated wire protocol that allows programs or scripts to introspect into, and control the behaviour of, a web browser.

edgestatus.name: SVG foreignobject element
edgestatus.summary: Allows for inclusion of a foreign namespace (such as HTML) which has its graphical content drawn by a different user agent

edgestatus.name: Media Queries Level 4: pointer and hover
edgestatus.summary: Allows to query the presence and accuracy of the user's pointing input (e.g. for differentiating touch versus mouse). Additionally, allows the page to query whether the user's pointing input supports hover.

edgestatus.name: Selection API
edgestatus.summary: Based on APIs from HTML5 and DOM Range, this specification includes additional methods for programmatically inspecting and modifying the selection.

edgestatus.name: ES6 Object Literal Enhancements
edgestatus.summary: Adds computed properties, concise method definitions, and short-hand for properties whose value is initialized to a same-named variable.

edgestatus.name: Promises (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Allows easier and cleaner asynchronous coding. Adds the Promise constructor, along with the 'all' and 'race' utility methods to the language itself.

edgestatus.name: Shared Memory and Atomics
edgestatus.summary: Shared memory and atomics for ECMAscript.

edgestatus.name: Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors
edgestatus.summary: ECMAScript proposal for Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptors.

edgestatus.name: Karaoke Web Standard
edgestatus.summary: Provides semantic language processing for two-way communication with a remote host. This new interface creates a system-to-system forced sonic recognition on the receiving party.

edgestatus.name: SVG External Content
edgestatus.summary: Allows referencing external content in SVG. A common use case for this would be <use xlink:href="lib.svg#template" fill="#000000"></use>

edgestatus.name: Meta Referrer
edgestatus.summary: Using the referrer metadata attribute, a document can control the behavior of the Referer HTTP header attached to requests that originate from the document.

edgestatus.name: dppx Unit for the resolution Media Query
edgestatus.summary: One dppx unit represents the number of 'dots' in a CSS px.

edgestatus.name: WAV Audio Support
edgestatus.summary: Enables PCM WAV audio support in HTML5 Audio.

edgestatus.name: DOM Event Constructors
edgestatus.summary: Replaces document.createEvent() and associated event object init methods with constructors for each event interface.

edgestatus.name: Math Built-ins (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Math related functions - sign, trunc, sinh, cosh, tanh, asinh, acosh, atanh, log10, log2, hypot, fround, clz32, cbrt, log1p, expm1.

edgestatus.name: Number Built-ins (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: New methods and properties on Number, including isFinite, isInteger, isSafeInteger, isNaN, EPSILON, MIN_SAFE_INTEGER, and MAX_SAFE_INTEGER.

edgestatus.name: String Built-ins (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: New methods on String including String.raw and String.fromCodePoint. New methods on String.prototype including codePointAt, normalize, repeat, startsWith, endsWith, and includes.

edgestatus.name: Object Built-ins (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: New methods on Object including assign, is, getOwnPropertySymbols, and setPrototypeOf

edgestatus.name: RegExp Built-ins (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: New methods on RegExp.prototype including match, replace, search, and split.

edgestatus.name: WeakSet (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Contains a set of objects such that those objects will be collected if they are not referenced anywhere else.

edgestatus.name: __proto__ (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Support for legacy prototype manipulation similar to Object.setPrototypeOf.

edgestatus.name: Classes (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Syntax for declaring classes.

edgestatus.name: Spread (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: The spread operator expands iterable expressions into individual arguments. For example, a.b(…array) is roughly the same as a.b.apply(a, array).

edgestatus.name: Template Strings (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: String literals that allow for expressions to be evaluated and concatenated with the string literal.

edgestatus.name: Tail Calls (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Enables boundlessly recursive algorithms (using constant stack space) for certain code patterns.

edgestatus.name: Subclassing (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Allows subclassing of built-in types such as Dates and Arrays.

edgestatus.name: SIMD (ES7)
edgestatus.summary: Enables Single Instruction, Multiple Data instructions to be used from Javascript programs.

edgestatus.name: Modules (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Language-level support for defining and consuming modules.

edgestatus.name: ASM.js
edgestatus.summary: Performance options for a low-level subset of JavaScript, including recognition of the 'use asm' directive and ahead-of-time compilation.

edgestatus.name: Clipboard API
edgestatus.summary: Standard APIs for interacting with the clipboard (copy/cut/paste operations). IE currently supports a legacy model for clipboard access.

edgestatus.name: Web Application Manifest
edgestatus.summary: This specification defines a JSON-based manifest, which provides developers with a centralized place to put metadata associated with a web application.

edgestatus.name: Public Key Pinning Extension for HTTP
edgestatus.summary: Certificate public key pinning is a mechanism which allows specifying a key that must be present in the certificate chain associated with a domain name. HTTP Public Key Pinning (HPKP) is one way of doing certificate public key pinning. In this method, site owner defines pin rules for his domain name via HTTP header. This mechanism assumes that user has had a first clean connection to the site.

edgestatus.name: ECMAScript Internationalization API
edgestatus.summary: Provides APIs for string comparison and date/time/number formatting in a locale-aware manner.

edgestatus.name: ES6 Numeric Literals
edgestatus.summary: Allows binary and octal numeric literals using 0b101 and 0o753 respectively.

edgestatus.name: <dialog> element for modals
edgestatus.summary: An HTML element for modal and non-modal dialog boxes

edgestatus.name: Color input type
edgestatus.summary: Input controls for picking colors via <input type='color'>.

edgestatus.name: Date-related input types
edgestatus.summary: Input controls for picking dates via <input type='date'>,<input type='month'>, and <input type='week'>.

edgestatus.name: Time-related input types
edgestatus.summary: Input controls for picking times via <input type='time'>, and <input type='datetime-local'>.

edgestatus.name: <main> element
edgestatus.summary: Semantic HTML5 element that represents the main content of the document or application.

edgestatus.name: <keygen> element
edgestatus.summary: A form element for a key pair generator control.  Support here indicates UI for picking keys and some transport to submit them. However, significant interoperability issues exist with the DOM interfaces and protocols for this feature.

edgestatus.name: Media Fragments
edgestatus.summary: Standardizes a URL fragment syntax for specifying a fragment of a media resource.

edgestatus.name: SVG+SMIL Animation
edgestatus.summary: XML-based syntax for specifying animations of SVG.

edgestatus.name: Hardware Concurrency
edgestatus.summary: An API for reading the system's total number of logical processors available to the user agent, up to an optional thread limit per origin.

edgestatus.name: Web Bluetooth
edgestatus.summary: An API for communicating with Bluetooth Low Energy devices as a GATT Client.

edgestatus.name: Web NFC API
edgestatus.summary: Enables NFC (near field communications) wireless communication between two devices at close proximity, usually less than a few centimeters

edgestatus.name: Shared Web Workers
edgestatus.summary: A special type of WebWorker that can commincate across windows/tabs for a site.

edgestatus.name: Platform for Privacy Preferences 1.0 (P3P 1.0)
edgestatus.summary: The Platform for Privacy Preferences Project (P3P) enables web sites to express their privacy practices in a standard format allowing user agents to automate decision-making based on these practices when appropriate.

edgestatus.name: WOFF File Format 2.0
edgestatus.summary: Based on experience with WOFF 1.0, which is widely deployed, this specification was developed to provide improved compression and thus lower use of network bandwidth, while still allowing fast decompression even on mobile devices. This is achieved by combining a content-aware preprocessing step and improved entropy coding, compared to the Flate compression used in WOFF 1.0.

edgestatus.name: Fetch API
edgestatus.summary: The Fetch specification defines requests, responses, and the process that binds them; fetching.

edgestatus.name: HTTP Live Streaming (HLS)
edgestatus.summary: Expands our plugin-free adaptive video streaming to support the popular HLS protocol for transferring unbounded streams of multimedia data.

edgestatus.name: Motion JPEG (MJPG)
edgestatus.summary: Adds support for the MJPG video format, popular with IP cameras.

edgestatus.name: CSS Gradient Midpoints
edgestatus.summary: Allows specifying an optional location between the color stops of a CSS gradient.

edgestatus.name: ARIA Landmark Roles
edgestatus.summary: Support for ARIA roles indicating regions of the page intended as navigational landmarks.

edgestatus.name: HTML Sections in Accessibility API
edgestatus.summary: Exposes HTML sectioning elements (such as section, article, main, etc.) in the Accessibility API.

edgestatus.name: Accessible Rich Internet Applications (WAI-ARIA) 1.1
edgestatus.summary: Full support for new WAI-ARIA 1.1 roles, states, and properties which define new accessible user interface elements since WAI-ARIA 1.0. Microsoft Edge currently supports the following ARIA roles: none, article, definition, log, math, note, scrollbar,  application, banner, complementary, contentinfo, form, main, navigation, search; and ARIA properties: aria-atomic, aria-autocomplete, aria-dropeffect, aria-grabbed, aria-label, aria-multiline, aria-orientation, aria-sort, aria-valuetext. Note that WAI-ARIA support is complex and not fully implemented in any browser.

edgestatus.name: Accessible Name and Description: Computation and API Mappings 1.1
edgestatus.summary: Determines names and descriptions of accessible objects to expose via UIA for assistive technologies to describe to users.

edgestatus.name: CSS Transitions for SVG elements
edgestatus.summary: Allows CSS Transitions for SVG elements.

edgestatus.name: Upgrade insecure resource requests
edgestatus.summary: A mechanism which allows authors to instruct a user agent to upgrade a priori insecure resource requests to secure transport before Fetching them.

edgestatus.name: CSS Logical Properties Level 1
edgestatus.summary: Introduces logical properties and values that provide the author with the ability to control layout through logical, rather than physical, direction and dimension mappings.

edgestatus.name: Console Logging APIs
edgestatus.summary: APIs to log messages to a connected developer tool. Covering console.assert, console.log, console.info, console.warn, console.error, console.debug, console.dir, console.dirxml.

edgestatus.name: console.table
edgestatus.summary: console.table allows the logging of tabular data to a connected developer tool.

edgestatus.name: CSS initial value
edgestatus.summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the initial keyword, the property’s initial value becomes its specified value.

edgestatus.name: CSS unset value
edgestatus.summary: If the cascaded value of a property is the ‘‘unset’#’ keyword, then if it is an inherited property, this is treated as ‘inherit’, and if it is not, this is treated as ‘initial’. This keyword effectively erases all declared values occurring earlier in the cascade, correctly inheriting or not as appropriate for the property (or all longhands of a shorthand).

edgestatus.name: showModalDialog
edgestatus.summary: The global showModalDialog() method displays a modal dialog box containing a specified HTML document. This feature has an incredibly high cost in terms of code complexity since it requires us to run an event loop on top of an arbitrary JavaScript stack. It also complicates the web platform by making task dispatch reentrant and hard to reason about.

edgestatus.name: Backdrop filter
edgestatus.summary: Applies a CSS filter effect to the content behind an element. This is not the element's background but the content that would be drawn behind it.

edgestatus.name: International input[type=email] validation
edgestatus.summary: Adding support for international email addresses that use UTF-8 characters (e.g. 伊昭傑@郵件.商務, राम@मोहन.ईन्फो)

edgestatus.name: WebM Container
edgestatus.summary: An open media container format.

edgestatus.name: Opus Audio Playback
edgestatus.summary: An open codec for audio playback.

edgestatus.name: Vorbis Audio Codec
edgestatus.summary: An open codec for audio.

edgestatus.name: Theora Video Codec
edgestatus.summary: An open video codec.

edgestatus.name: OGG Container
edgestatus.summary: An open multimedia container.

edgestatus.name: VP9 Video Playback
edgestatus.summary: An open codec for video optimized on the web. In the current release, VP9 is only automatically enabled when hardware acceleration is detected. VP9 support can be toggled manually via about:flags.

edgestatus.name: VP8 for RTC
edgestatus.summary: Support for the VP8 video format in RTC scenarios.

edgestatus.name: H.264/AVC for RTC
edgestatus.summary: Support for H.264/AVC in RTC scenarios.

edgestatus.name: RTC Data Channels
edgestatus.summary: Data channels allow a web application to send and receive generic application data peer-to-peer.

edgestatus.name: image-rendering
edgestatus.summary: Provides a hint to the browser on which scaling algorithm should be used.

edgestatus.name: Conic Gradients
edgestatus.summary: Specifies a gradient where the color stops are placed around the circumference of a circle.

edgestatus.name: CSS Motion Path
edgestatus.summary: Motion paths allow authors to animate any graphical object along an author specified path.

edgestatus.name: CSS image-set()
edgestatus.summary: Enables responsive images in CSS by specifiying multiple resolutions of an image that the browser can select from for the given situation.

edgestatus.name: CSS all shorthand
edgestatus.summary: The all property is a shorthand that resets all CSS properties except direction and unicode-bidi

edgestatus.name: CSS vmax unit
edgestatus.summary: A viewport relative length unit equal to the larger of vw (viewport width) or vh (viewport height).

edgestatus.name: CSS Contextual Reference Element Pseudo-class :scope
edgestatus.summary: The :scope pseudo-class represents any element that is in the contextual reference element set.

edgestatus.name: CSS tab-size property
edgestatus.summary: The tab-size property sets the size used to render tab characters in situations where white space is preserved

edgestatus.name: CSS Relational Pseudo-class :has
edgestatus.summary: The relational pseudo-class, :has(), is a functional pseudo-class taking a relative selector list as an argument. Similar to jQuery’s :has() selector.

edgestatus.name: CSS Level 3 attr() function
edgestatus.summary: Support the attr() function as a component value in properties applied to an element. Currently, attr() is only supported in the content property applied to pseudo-elements.

edgestatus.name: <menu> Element
edgestatus.summary: An HTML element for toolbars and popup menus.

edgestatus.name: <time> Element
edgestatus.summary: An HTML element for representing dates and times.

edgestatus.name: <data> Element
edgestatus.summary: An HTML element which represents its content in machine-readable and human-readable formats.

edgestatus.name: <output> Element
edgestatus.summary: An HTML element for representing the result of a calculation or user action.

edgestatus.name: ol[reversed] attribute
edgestatus.summary: A boolean attribute that reverses the order of an ordered list when present.

edgestatus.name: Screen Capture
edgestatus.summary: Screen Capture API allows a user's display or parts thereof be used as the source of a media stream.

edgestatus.name: Form attribute
edgestatus.summary: Attribute for associating input and submit buttons with a form.

edgestatus.name: Reflect (ES6)
edgestatus.summary: Provides methods for use in operations that are intercepted. Reflect methods are often used with proxies because they allow you to delegate to default behavior without implementing the default behavior in your code.

edgestatus.name: FindText API
edgestatus.summary: Provides an API for finding ranges of text in a document, with a variety of selection criteria. Similar to a user-agent's find-on-page or page-search capability.

edgestatus.name: Web Payments API
edgestatus.summary: A web API to allow merchants (i.e. web sites selling physical or digital goods) to easily accept payments from different payment methods with minimal integration.

edgestatus.name: Web Assembly (MVP)
edgestatus.summary: WebAssembly or wasm is a new portable, size- and load-time-efficient format suitable for compilation to the web.

edgestatus.name: CSS Font Loading API
edgestatus.summary: This CSS module describes events and interfaces used for dynamically loading font resources.

edgestatus.name: Cache API
edgestatus.summary: The Cache API consists of additional ServiceWorker APIs which allow authors to fully and conveniently manage their content caches for offline use. An origin can have multiple, named Cache objects, whose contents are entirely under the control of Service Worker scripts.

edgestatus.name: Touch-action: pan-up pan-down pan-left pan-right CSS properties
edgestatus.summary: Adds additional direction-specific values for the CSS touch-action property for pan-up, pan-down, pan-left, pan-right have been added to the specification.

features.comment: A prefix version :-webkit-any-link has been available for a while but it was not 100% compliant to the specification.
features.description: The pseudo class :any-link matches any element that would match :link or :visisted.
features.name: CSS Selector :any-link

features.description: The selector :focus-within matches an element if the element or a descendant has the focus.
features.name: CSS Selector :focus-within

features.description: The selector :lang() is extended in level 4 to support a list of language range, each range can contain a wildcard. For example: p:lang("*-be", "en").
features.name: CSS Selector :lang() level 4

features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :matches().
features.description: The selector :matches() takes a selector list as argument and matches an element if any of them matches (e.g. :matches(article > section, #target)). When used for styling, the specificity of :matches() is the higest specificity of all selectors in the selector list.
features.name: CSS Selector :matches()

features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :not().
features.description: The selector :not() in level 4 supports full selector lists as argument. For example: :not(:any-link >> img, :any-link >> picture).
features.name: CSS Selector :not() level 4

features.comment: The pseudo classes :visited and :link are not supported inside :nth-child() and :nth-last-child().
features.description: The pseudo classes :nth-child() and :nth-last-child() now supports a selector list that filters what to count. For example: ":nth-child(even of .visible)".
features.name: CSS Selector :nth-child(An+B of selector list) and :nth-last-child(An+B of selector list)

features.comment: Styling the placeholder can be done through the WebKit pseudo-element "::placeholder".
features.description: The selector :placeholder-shown matches any input element that has a visible placeholder.
features.name: CSS Selector :placeholder-shown

features.comment: The implementation is feature complete and shipping, but is -webkit prefixed.
features.description: CSS Shapes describe geometric shapes for use in CSS. For Level 1, CSS Shapes can be applied to floats.
features.name: CSS Shapes Level 1

features.description: Any attribute selector that test a value can take a flag "i" to use case insensitive checks. For example: input[type=number i] test the value "number" case-insensitively.
features.name: Case-insensitive attribute selectors

features.description: Defines gradients wrapped around a central point.
features.name: Conic Gradients
features.specification: CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 4

features.description: Define a custom HTML tag and associate it with an ES6 class.
features.name: Custom Elements

features.description: An attribute to an anchor or area element to indicate that a resource is intended to be downloaded for use later rather than immediately.
features.name: Download Attribute

features.description: Find the closest ancestor matching the selector passed as argument. The element itself is returned if it matches the selector.
features.name: Element.closest()

features.description: This property specifies styling for filters applied to the backdrop of an element.
features.name: Filter Effects backdrop-filter propery

features.description: Provide the events necessary to handle force click events in the page, overriding the default behavior.
features.name: Force Click Events

features.comment: There are concerns about the disconnect between this specification and ES6 Modules. WebKit has no intent to support the current specification.
features.description: Includes resusable HTML documents in other HTML documents.
features.name: HTML imports

features.description: An interface for drawing bitmap images to a <canvas> without undue latency.
features.name: ImageBitmap

features.description: This property specifies styling for dropped, raised, and sunken initial letters.
features.name: Initial Letter

features.description: The "pointer" media defines how percise the pointing device is. The "hover" media defines the ability of the poiting device to hover elements.
features.name: Interaction Media Features (pointer, hover, any-pointer, any-hover)

features.comment: WebKit used to support MicroData. The feature never gained any traction and was eventually removed to clean up the codebase.
features.name: MicroData

features.description: Navigator.hardwareConcurrency provides the total number of logical processors available to the user agent.
features.name: Navigator.hardwareConcurrency

features.description: Enable handling the art-direction responsive images use-case by defining multiple image sources in markup
features.name: Picture element

features.comment: The feature is prefixed with -webkit-. There are some remaining issues to resolve in the specification.
features.description: Sticky positioning provides a way to position element out of the normal flow when scrolling. Unlike solutions based on JavaScript, the change of position is synchronized with scrolling.
features.name: Position: sticky

features.description: Provides a declarative fetch primitive that initiates an early fetch and separates fetching from resource execution.
features.name: Preload

features.comment: The implementation does not support ReadableStreamBYOBReader.
features.name: Readable Streams

features.description: Functional encapsulation of HTML and CSS for Web Components.
features.name: Shadow DOM

features.comment: The implementation of Shared Web Workers was imposing undesirable constraints on the engine. The feature never gained any adoption and was eventually removed from the engine.
features.name: Shared Web Workers

features.description: Enable handling the variable width responsive images use-case by defining multiple image resources in markup
features.name: Srcset w descriptor and related sizes attribute

features.description: Enable handling the fixed width responsive images use-case by defining multiple image resources in markup
features.name: Srcset x descriptor

features.description: Extends script and link elements with an integrity attribute that contains a cryptographic hash of the representation of the resource the author expects to load.
features.name: Subresource Integrity

features.description: Declares HTML fragments that can be cloned and inserted into the document by a script.
features.name: Template Element

specification.name: CSS Image Values and Replaced Content Module Level 4
CSS Properties and Values API Level 1
CSS Scroll Snap Points Module Level 1

specification.description: Allows developers to define reusable custom property values.
specification.name: CSS Variables

specification.description: A mechanism that web applications can use to mitigate content injection vulnerabilities, such as cross-site scripting (XSS). Developers can declare a CSP policy to prohibit their web application from loading content or executing scripts that have not been whitelisted among other capabilities.
specification.name: Content Security Policy Level 2

specification.description: An underlying unified architecture for making resource requests.
specification.name: Fetch API

specification.description: A standard interface to a browser database of records for simple values and objects. IndexedDB currently matches the W3C recommended spec (version 1). We are participating in development of version 2 of the spec and plan to implement new features as they stabilize.
specification.name: IndexedDB

specification.description: Provides a declarative fetch primitive that initiates an early fetch and separates fetching from resource execution.
specification.name: Preload

specification.description: Provides detailed timing information to JavaScript for sub-resources loaded by the page.
specification.name: Resource Timing

specification.description: A method for browsers to run JavaScript in the background to handle network requests and manage cached responses. Service Workers offers a replacement for Application Cache.
specification.name: Service Workers

specification.description: Improves compression to reduce bandwidth with content-aware preprocessing.
specification.name: WOFF File Format 2.0

specification.description: An API to synchronize with the timing for presentation changes of a web page.
specification.name: Web Animations

specification.description: A collection of technologies to improve modularization of DOM subtrees.
specification.name: Web Components

specification.description: A JavaScript API for web applications to perform cryptographic operations.
specification.name: WebCrypto

specification.description: An API to facilitate real-time communication for browser-to-browser applications.
specification.name: WebRTC
